{{Wired embedded system |brand=Arris |model=CM8200 |revision=(A/B) |est_release_date=02/2017 |type=cable modem |availability=Cox (US), NBN (AU) <!-- ISP-supplied --> |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM3390 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu1_cores= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |jtag= |serial= |eth_cpu=yes |eth_chip2_brand=Broadcom |eth_chip2_model= |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=2 |wan_speed=5GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags=DOCSIS 3.1, TR-069, |default_ip=192.168.100.1 }} {{TagLine|SURFboard DOCSIS 3.1 Cable Modem}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.arris.com/products/touchstone-cm8200-cable-modem//}} {{•}} [https://www.arris.com/globalassets/resources/data-sheets/touchstone-cm8200-data-sheet.pdf Datasheet] {{•}} [https://www.arris.com/globalassets/resources/brochures/docsis-brochure-sept.pdf PBrief] :[https://www.cox.com/content/dam/cox/residential/support/internet/print_media/Arris-CM8200-UserGuide.pdf User Manual (Cox)] {{•}} [https://www.cox.com/residential/support/arris-cm8200.html Support page (Cox)]
*32×8 DOCSIS 3.0 *2×2 DOCSIS 3.1<!--
-->{{CableModemSpec |down_c=32 |up_c=8 }}
===Variants=== *'''CM8200A''': NA DOCSIS, PN 1000336 *'''CM8200B''': EURO DOCSIS, PN 1000225 <small> The Arris CM8200 is a DOCSIS 3.1 layer-2 cable modem approved by several ISPs and widely distributed :in Australia for HFC (hybrid fibre coaxial) implementations of the National Broadband Network (NBN). Two revisions exist, A and B. Apparently the CM8200 is functionally identical to the '''[[Arris SB8200]]'''. <ref>{{cite |url=https://www.dslreports.com/forum/r31832004-Arris-SB8200-vs-CM8200-for-WOW-Gigatopia |title=Arris SB200 vs CM8200 for WOW Gigatopia |publisher=DSL Reports}}</ref> :It has one coaxial F connector for connection to a cable network (5-204 MHz US; 108-1002 MHz DS), :and two RJ45 ports which are implemented differently depending on the vendor. </small>
===Forum threads=== *[https://bc.whirlpool.net.au/bc/hardware/?action=h_view&model_id=1737 Arris CM8200] at Whirlpool forums *[https://www.dslreports.com/forum/r31832004-Arris-SB8200-vs-CM8200-for-WOW-Gigatopia Arris SB200 vs CM8200] at ''DSL Reports'' *[https://forums.whirlpool.net.au/archive/2615884 Arris HFC modem - Find Sync Speed?] at ''Whirlpool'' *[https://forums.whirlpool.net.au/archive/2622675 Arris CM8200 NBN HFC modem web interface?] at ''Whirlpool'' *[https://www.reddit.com/r/Comcast/comments/834bv7/touchstone_cm8200_docsis_31_cable_modem_not_fully/ Touchstone CM8200 DOCSIS 3.1 Cable Modem] at /r/comcast *[https://arstechnica.com/civis/viewtopic.php?t=1377267&start=40 Arris SB8200 cable modem - thoughts?] at Ars Technica
===Support=== *[https://iihelp.iinet.net.au/Arris_CM8200_for_NBN_HFC_Status_Lights Status lights] at iiNet *[https://www.nbnco.com.au/content/dam/nbnco2/documents/Connect-Kits/res/1730118_HFC_Setup_Guide_180x130mm_NO%20PAY%20TV_1.0.pdf National Broadband Network] (Australia)
====NBN features==== *On NBN units, the RJ45 ports are labelled UNI-D1 and UNI-D2, :and normally on UNI-D1 is used <ref>{{cite |url=https://www.reddit.com/r/nbn/comments/6ym4v8/dual_hfc_nbn_connections_is_this_doable_if_so_how/ |title=Dual HFC NBN Connections? Is this do-able? If so how? |publisher=/r/nbn}}</ref> *The web GUI is inaccessible after the configuration is loaded <ref>{{cite |url=https://forums.whirlpool.net.au/archive/2622675 |title=Arris CM8200 NBN HFC modem web interface? |publisher=Whirlpool}}</ref> <ref>{{cite |url=https://forums.whirlpool.net.au/archive/2615884 |title=Arris HFC modem - Find Sync Speed? |publisher=Whirlpool}}</ref>
